title: Understanding the Cell Components
text: Identify the anode and cathode in the galvanic cell. The anode is where oxidation occurs, and the cathode is where reduction occurs.

title: Oxidation and Reduction Reactions
text: Write the half-reactions for the oxidation and reduction processes. Use the given standard reduction potentials.

title: Calculating the Standard Cell Potential
text: Use the formula: E°cell $$=$$ E°cathode - E°anode. Substitute the given values for the reduction potentials.

title: Identify the Anode and Cathode
text: Which metal acts as the anode and which as the cathode in this cell?

title: Write the Half-Reactions
text: What are the half-reactions for the anode and cathode?

title: Calculate E°cell
text: Calculate the standard cell potential using the formula E°cell $$=$$ E°cathode - E°anode.
